SUB_W07_WRLD_SIUG_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_WRLD_SIUG_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.text:
It does not seem any of the souls in my
warrior band guided me to this world.

SUB_W07_WRLD_SIUG_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_WRLD_SIUG_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.text:
As such, I can relax and merely
enjoy my time here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Mmm. A destroyed altar. But was it done
at the hands of an enemy, or a believer
betrayed by misplaced faith? Yes, this could prove to be
a most enjoyable world indeed.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Ah, some lesser spirit.
An imp, perhaps?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Begone, imp! I've no use
for you or your ilk.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
It appears the welcoming
party has arrived.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text: We've a visitor at the Soul Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
A Flamewave League spy, perhaps?
I've not seen his like before.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
As if we would recruit so
ostentatious an agent!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
The Soul Temple has been the site of strange
phenomena since ancient times. Is that not
why we banded together to destroy it?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Are you suggesting this creature is
a Soul Voyager? Are we to be ruled
by the Soul Temple even now?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
If he is indeed a Soul Voyager,
we of the Flamewave League
will not engage with him.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
And nor will we of the
Forestgale Alliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
It seems I've found the culprits behind the
ruined altar. Yet they must be creatures of
low significance if they cannot discern the
magnitude of the Dismal King's power.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
If you insist on flittering about me so,
at least make yourself useful by serving
as my guide. Even a lesser spirit such as
yourself can manage that, no?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
I'm being guided here?
If so, those men are liars who
covet my power after all.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Be welcome at the Flame Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
I gather you wish to make my power your own.
But first, explain what you mean when you
name me a 'Soul Voyager.'

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
The Four Tribes of Cinq once had our lives
controlled by the Soul Temple. Eventually
we grew to despise its dominion over us,
and so banded together to destroy it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
In the days when we were still under its sway,
travelers would occasionally appear. We named
them Soul Voyagers, for whatever they sought
would greatly affect the lives of all in Cinq.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
We know well the power of a Soul Voyager,
and humbly request your assistance in
defeating the Forestgale Alliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Flamewave League and the Forestgale Alliance. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Flamewave League!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Take whatever time you need.
We await your favorable reply.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
You there! Imp! Where did you run off to?
Do you fear to be spotted by those men?
Welladay if so, for I wager it is the fate
of your kind to be mocked and abused.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Should I grant this
temple my strength?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text: They seem worthy of my aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.text:
Does the Flame Temple seek
my assistance as well?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Flamewave League do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.text:
Should I grant this
temple my strength?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.text: They seem worthy of my aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Thank you, Soul Voyager.
Now then, if I may be so bold as to
ask, we would appreciate your help.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
You stand before the Dismal King.
Do not waste my time with requests
that are unworthy of my brilliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text:
Be welcome at the Wave Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Waveflame League and the Forestgale Alliance. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Waveflame League!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.text:
Does the Wave Temple seek
my assistance as well?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Waveflame League do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
Be welcome at the Gale Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
We know well the power of a Soul Voyager,
and humbly request your assistance in
defeating the Flamewave League.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Galeforest Alliance and the Flamewave League. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Galeforest Alliance!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.text:
Does the Gale Temple seek
my assistance as well?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Galeforest Alliance do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text:
Be welcome at the Forest Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Forestgale Alliance and the Flamewave League. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Forestgale Alliance!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.text:
Does the Forest Temple seek
my assistance as well?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Forestgale Alliance do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We must boost our economic strength
if we hope to win this war. To this end,
we are creating factories one after another,
putting a strain on our energy supply.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
As our League has heat sources and water
in abundance, we use steam as our primary
means of generating power.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Go on.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The output of our steam plant is dropping.
Should the Soul Voyager stop by, I am sure
both the problem and its solution will be
made apparent.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Consider it done.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_000_00.text:
What possible purpose does
this crude structure serve?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_000_02.speaker: Nitram

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_000_03.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_000_03.text: What would you have me do?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_010_00.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_010_00.text:
I expected no less from you, Voyager!
Those fiends are sent by the Forestgale
Alliance, and perpetually cause damage
in this place. But today, the plant remains unharmed!
Sadly for the beasts, they cannot say the same.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_141_CUT_010_01.text:
I do not expect the Forestgale Alliance
to launch another attack any time soon,
so thank you again for your efforts.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
With the issue at the steam plant resolved,
our factories can now operate at full capacity.
However, we've realized our transportation
infrastructure cannot handle the output.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We need more harbors and ships. Furthermore,
our current lack of shipyards will surely lead
to additional problems down the road.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And what would you have
me do about this?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'd like to ask you to visit a shipyard
construction site, where I feel certain
your presence will cause something
quite beneficial to transpire.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Dismal King will
grant you this boon.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_00.text:
So they are building a place that then builds
ships? How extraordinarily tedious.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_02.text:
Welcome, Voyager! Your arrival will
surely hasten the construction of
this important site!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_03.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_03.text:
Mmm. The Dismal King has truly
graced you on this day.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_04.text:
A pity my generosity has not been repaid
with the presence of anyone sufficiently
interesting to join me as my thrall.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_05.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_05.text:
Ah. You return. Where do you intend
to lead me this time?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_06.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_06.text: You wish me to open this crate?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_07.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_07.text:
Is this the contraption called a 'bomb'?
It seems ready to explode imminently.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_08.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_08.text:
Are you all right, Voyager!?
I heard an explosion!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_09.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_09.text:
Someone wished to turn your site
into a smoking crater.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_10.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_10.text:
This is clearly the work of the Forestgale
Alliance—one of their spies must have
infiltrated the site. I will begin a
thorough investigation at once!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_11.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_11.text:
How did you locate that bomb,
if you don't mind my asking?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_12.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_12.text:
Must I repeat myself? I am Siugnas,
the Dismal King. That is answer enough.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_13.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_000_13.text:
Well, regardless, your being here
was clearly a blessing. Thank you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_010_00.text:
I suppose I have you to thank for
this perfectly tedious affair.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_010_01.text:
If you keep getting in our way, Voyager,
I'm afraid I'll have to get rid of you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_010_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_142_CUT_010_02.text:
Finally, something interesting in my day.
Behold the might of the Dismal King!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'm given to understand that you foiled the
enemy's attempt to sabotage our new shipyard.
You Soul Voyagers truly are special beings!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Construction of the shipyard is now complete,
offering a solution to our long-term shipping
problems. However, we would like to bring our
war with the Forestgale Alliance to a swifter end.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Ah! The final battle approaches!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The backbone of the Forestgale Alliance's
economy is their system of railways.
Something must be done about it.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Oh, how hideously banal.
I could not possibly care less.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
All we ask is that you visit a train
station of the Forestgale Alliance.
The rest will take care of itself.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_00.text:
So this is a Forestgale Alliance train station?
Mmm. It seems boxes carry goods and passengers
as they travel to and fro along that metal road.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_01.text:
Ah, the Soul Voyager!
What are you doing here?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_02.text:
I have come in hopes of meeting someone
worthy of my interest. Alas, I have happened
upon no one here capable of making the
harpstrings of my soul even quiver.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_03.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_03.text:
As much as I would hate to see a voyager leave
here unsatisfied, I urge you to do exactly that.
Also, if you choose to stay, your every action
will be carefully monitored.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_04.text:
Ah, I may yet find my satisfaction!
That man there certainly managed
to entertain me when last we met.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_06.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_06.text:
I trust you've seen enough?
Perhaps it's time you departed.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_07.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_07.text:
What was the point of
bringing me here?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_08.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_08.text:
Where the Voyager travels, calamity follows.
I am relieved to see that this instance
proved to be the exception to the—

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_09.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_09.text:
Indeed it was—for disaster
struck where I was not.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_10.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_10.text:
And we were too distracted with the voyager
to see it coming! Damn you, Voyager!
You have brought ruin upon us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_11.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_11.text:
If that was their intention, they should have
made a show of it. It would certainly make
this world a more appealing place.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_12.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_143_CUT_000_12.text:
Do you challenge my opinion, imp?
The audacity of you!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our verdant forests supply our Alliance
with an ample amount of lumber.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sadly, we have fallen far behind in
the task of processing said lumber;
we simply cannot afford to maintain
the necessary workforce.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Have you considered mechanizing
this process of yours?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed we have, which is why the tribes of gale
and forest have begun working together to construct
a mill. However, the project is beset with issues
that I am hoping you might resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The peoples of gale and forest have begun
working together to construct a lumber mill.
However, the project is beset with issues
that I am hoping you might resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Naught is beyond the capacity
of the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_00.text:
This is where they build their machine?
They've made barely any progress at all.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_02.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_02.text:
I am pleased to see you come, Voyager. Alas,
those of the Gale Tribe who are supposed to
be helping us construct the mill refuse to work. Might I ask you to scold them in my stead?
While they ignore me, they'll not so easily
shrug off a rebuke from a Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_03.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_03.text:
I would be happy to. And should a
scolding prove inadequate, I have
more serious means at my disposal.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_04.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_04.text:
The work is just too dangerous! These woods
are filled with all manner of horrid beasts,
and they're perpetually waiting for a chance
to make us their dinner! We tried telling the Forest Tribe that you can't
build a mill when you're always looking over
your shoulder, but they don't seem to care!
I simply don't understand their kind...

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_05.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_05.text:
This hardly seems the sort of forest
to be teeming with deadly creatures.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_06.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_06.text: Why, this is no beast at all!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_07.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_07.text:
To the Forest Tribe, beasts of the wood are
treasured neighbors with whom we coexist. And while we do eat them at times, our hunting
season is primarily for population control.
We cannot simply slaughter them indiscriminately
to ease the nerves of some cowardly gale people!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_08.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_08.text:
The creature I fought was
no beast, but a fiend.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_09.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_09.text: Hmm. We have sensed a disturbing decline in the beasts' numbers of late, so perhaps this is the reason. Which means... Of course! Those villains from the Flamewave League must be releasing fiends into our woods! Might I ask you to cull the numbers of these interlopers, Voyager?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_10.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_000_10.text:
I suppose there is sport
enough in a good hunt.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_010_00.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_010_00.text:
Now the Gale Tribe can
work without fear.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_231_CUT_010_01.text:
I can't believe the Flamewave League was behind
those monsters! They very nearly managed to
cause strife between us and the Forest Tribe,
and they will pay dearly for it!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Thanks to the new mill, we'll be able to
finish some large-scale construction
projects that were on hold.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our next project is installing wind turbines in the
Gale Tribe's residential district. If we complete
that, the Alliance's energy production will finally
be comparable to that of the League.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And you intend to beg
more boons from me?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Oh, I appreciate someone who doesn't beat
around the bush! The crux of it is this: we expect
the League to attempt to sabotage the project,
for there's no low their kind won't sink to.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our next project is installing wind turbines
in the Gale Tribe's residential district.
But we expect the League to attempt sabotage,
for there's no low their kind won't sink to.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And I'm to stop them by any means
necessary? Enjoyable enough.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_00.text:
This is quite the impressive structure.
I daresay the scale of it rivals even my
own royal palace.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_01.text:
Yes, and the greater the project,
the harder it is to defend. We've already had a rash of suspicious fires
that destroyed precious materials recently
delivered from the mill. Without a doubt,
this is the work of the Flamewave League.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_02.text:
I am eager to see what means of
sabotage they might employ next.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_05.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_05.text:
Pah! You scurry like mice at a glimpse
of little more than my silhouette!
Is there not a hero among you with
the courage to face the Dismal King!?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_06.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_06.text:
Thanks to you, our materials are safe,
and construction is proceeding smoothly.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_07.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_07.text:
I care not a whit for such things!
I wish only to face some semblance
of a satisfying resistance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_09.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_09.text: Fiend! A giant fiend is coming!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_10.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_000_10.text:
How I have waited for this...
Behold the power of the Dismal King!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_010_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_232_CUT_010_01.text:
Ah, but I suppose there is nothing for it.
Even as lesser a being as yourself clearly
recognizes the might of the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Various industries have been reaping the
benefit of the Alliance's new wind energy,
and our economic prospects seem bright.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sadly, while we strive to live in greater
harmony with nature than the Flamewave League,
this has put us at a disadvantage in the war.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Even with our recent gains,
our loss is inevitable.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
What hope have you of winning
a fight when you've bound your
own hands behind your back?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our only option would be to attack the enemy's
infrastructure. If we can destroy their port,
we will deal a great blow to their economy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Then strike at it—and do so yourself!
You avail yourself nothing by relying on
the whims of outsiders to win your war.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_00.text:
Now we shall see what these beings are made of.
If they are capable of doing what must be done,
then perhaps I will come to find them ever so
slightly more appealing.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_01.text: Can you follow that logic, imp?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_02.text:
You have come, Voyager—
just as our intelligence predicted.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_03.text:
We know you are planning to destroy the port,
and I will not allow it! Your meddling will cause
no harm to the League today!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_04.text:
Using no less a man than the Dismal King as a
decoy? I tip my hat to the sheer audacity of it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_05.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_05.text:
Cease your mumbling! Now then, tell me who sent you and
why you have come. I need to hear
a confession from your own lips.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_06.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_233_CUT_000_06.text:
Finally, they fight of their own initiative!
There is no stopping them now.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Our long war is finally over!
The Flamewave League stands victorious!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Our League has proven its dominance
thanks to the Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Should your travels bring you to this
world again, please do visit our temple.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
This world has the potential
to grow ever more appealing.
What is it that stops them?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text: Do you know the answer, imp?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
You truly do not know?
Or do you simply feign ignorance?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text: I am done with this place.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Our long war is finally over!
The Forestgale Alliance stands victorious!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Our Alliance has proven its dominance
thanks to the Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Should your travels bring you to this
world again, please do visit our temple.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
They declare this to be ended just as they
finally embrace the seduction of the dark!
Yet it is no matter, for I know the darkness
will continue to befoul them from within.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Even you understand what
is happening here, imp.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text: They are unfit to serve me. I will go.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text: I will stay here a while longer.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
You must understand the reason
your altar lies in ruins.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
My presence here should push them to
a more fervent embrace of the dark.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
You have come at an opportune time,
Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Mmm. My premonition was right:
there is a bleakness in the air.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Yes, we have been feeling much the same—in fact,
we now suspect the Wave Tribe intends to attack!
Therefore, we must make a proactive move,
lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Flame and wave—as trite a metaphor for
incompatibility as one could ever find. Yet through some miracle, your peoples
managed to work as one. Why would you
abandon that alliance so readily?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Wave Temple sees things differently,
and has decreed our people can never be one.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Take whatever time you need.
We await your favorable reply.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Even in my absence, they continue their
march into darkness. What think you, imp?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
You must accept reality: the war will rage
until but one faction remains. This will never
become the world you wish it to be.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.text:
Aaah ha ha ha! Finally, this world
is beginning to appeal to me!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Wave Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Bleakness, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Flame Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Flame and wave—as trite a metaphor for
incompatibility as one could ever find. Yet through some miracle, your peoples
managed to work as one. Why would you
abandon that alliance so readily?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Flame Temple sees things differently,
and has decreed our people can never be one.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Flame Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Bleakness, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Forest Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
I am confused. Was the plan not for the
Gale and Forest people to live closely
together in a mutual respect for nature?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Forest Temple sees things differently,
and claims the forest has no need of wind.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Forest Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Bleakness, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Gale Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
I am confused. Was the plan not for the
Forest and Gale people to live closely
together in a mutual respect for nature?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Gale Temple sees things differently,
and declared the woods an obstacle to wind.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Gale Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We were able to claim victory in our war
against the Forestgale Alliance due to our
superior energy production.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And now you intend to build another
of your grand facilities?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No. That would take far too long, causing
us to fall behind in the war against the
wave people. Instead, we seek to upgrade
our current plant.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Waste not the time of the Dismal King
with talk of engineering and technology!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I ask only that you visit the plant.
That should ensure all goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Mmm. Then I shall conduct myself in a
manner befitting the lord of darkness.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_00.text:
The energy produced here benefits the
Wave Tribe as well. Why would you
expect them to attack the facility?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_01.text:
Because their incessant harassment
has completely stalled our plans
to upgrade the power plant!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_02.text:
Yes, I suppose I can appreciate your
predicament. What exactly do they do?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_03.text:
They loose fiends near the cooling pools,
which both endangers our staff and reduces
the plant's efficiency.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_000_04.text:
Fiends yet again. This manner of work is
beneath the dignity of the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_010_00.text: Harassment was all those fiends were capable of. Are you certain the Wave Tribe intended that to be an act of war?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_101_CUT_010_01.text:
While you have my gratitude, Voyager,
you know little of the Wave Tribe.
They are indeed set on annihilating
our kind!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We wish to make use of various minerals
which can be obtained from volcanoes.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And you use the heat of the
volcano to melt ore, I take it?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: You are rather ignorant about our technology, Voyager. We are only securing the minerals from the volcano; we will later smelt them using the heat from our steam plant.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Dismal King is not some soot-stained
forge worker who requires such knowledge!
Save such lectures for the rabble!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed... We will use that energy to power
our forges, which will allow us to make ever
more potent weapons and lead us to victory!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We will use that energy to power our forges,
which will allow us to make ever more potent
weapons and lead us to a great victory!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
At long last, it appears they
have grown serious about war.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_01.text:
What you are feeling is the heat from the
volcano mingling with our fiery enthusiasm
for these ironworks.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_02.text:
How quickly time spent in this
heat robs me of my vitality.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_03.text:
The fire fiends here don't like our presence.
And while we're not afraid of their attacks,
per se, we also haven't figured out an
effective strategy to combat them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_000_04.text:
You may entrust that task
to the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_102_CUT_010_01.text:
Thank you! Now we can finish the
ironworks without further incident.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We have arrived at a decision, Voyager:
we are going to destroy the shipyard
that once stood as a proud symbol
of the Flamewave League's unity.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Wonderful. Then there will be
no mistaking your resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The psychological damage it will deal
to the Wave Tribe is the best way to
ensure a rapid victory against them.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Psychological damage is invaluable in war.
Will you be requiring my aid?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We will win this war with or without
your assistance, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_000_00.text:
You intend to leave me
out of this phase?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_000_01.text:
I understand how you must feel, Voyager,
seeing as you once risked your life in defense
of the shipyard. But there is no other choice
left to us.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_000_02.text:
Those fools lack even the faintest idea
of my desires—and, it seems, of yours.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_010_00.text:
That should ensure the successful
completion of their objective.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_010_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_103_CUT_010_01.text:
I look forward to seeing the depths
of zeal this inspires in them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
We have destroyed all the enemy
temples thanks to your good work.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You were seduced by my darkness,
then further driven to serve it.
Behold now how it pervades your world!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
No, of course not. Regardless, now that only
the Flame Temple remains, we can finally
cover the entirety of Cinq with magma.
Then only we will remain!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You have served us well, Soul Voyager,
and I wish to grant you tribute.
What is it you desire?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
I desire all those you have
dominated to serve me.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our transportation infrastructure gives us an
advantage over the Flame Tribe, for we can move
more on our waterways than on any land route—
so long as we have the ships, that is.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And now you intend to build another
of your grand facilities?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No. That would take far too long, causing
us to fall behind in the war against the
Flame Tribe. Instead, we seek to upgrade
our current one.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Waste not the time of the Dismal King
with talk of engineering and technology!

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I ask only that you visit the shipyard.
That should ensure all goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Mmm. Then I shall conduct myself in a
manner befitting the lord of darkness.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_00.text:
You protected this shipyard once.
What will you do now?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_01.text:
For my part, I will hear
what they have to say.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_02.text:
While our shipyard is capable of producing
large-scale vessels, its facilities are
lacking due to its hasty construction
in the midst of the war. And since building large vessels is an
inefficient process at the best of times,
we must see this situation rectified.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_03.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_03.text:
As expected, this is not a matter
in which I can assist you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_04.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_04.text: Ha ha! We certainly do not expect your help with that, Voyager. We have specialists in that field arriving any min—

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_05.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_000_05.text:
On the vessel that is
currently under attack?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_010_00.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_010_00.text:
You truly have a knack for being where
you are needed most, Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_010_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_401_CUT_010_01.text: Such is the power of the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our waterways are now so crowded that
we fear the possibility of a collision.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Mmm. Spirits of the dead invite darkness,
leading to further tragedy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to construct a lighthouse
and highlight safe shipping routes.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
So your answer is to exorcise the darkness?
A most provocative choice. Once complete,
I wish to see this contraption.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Actually, I would prefer
that you go see it now.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would like you to visit the
lighthouse construction site.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And what awaits me there, I wonder?
I am excited to find out.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_00.text: Lies! There is nothing here at all!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_01.text:
Yet had you waited, there would be no
lighthouse to see, for fiends are currently
preventing us from building it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_02.text:
And you blame the Flame Tribe?
Do you truly believe them to be
capable of such a thing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_03.text:
No, in fact—these appear to be native
creatures who simply don't appreciate
what we're doing in their territory.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_000_04.text:
Simple beasts, then. They must be
taught to heed the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_010_00.text:
How many of these infernal
creatures must I fight?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_010_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_402_CUT_010_01.text:
The fiends should calm down once
construction is finished and we
vacate the area.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We have arrived at a decision, Voyager:
we are going to destroy the steam plant
that once stood as a proud symbol of
the Waveflame League's unity.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The enemy must be tightening their
defenses if you're forced to hit a
site of importance to you both.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, but it is still the best way to ensure
a rapid victory against the Flame Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I remain doubtful you are capable
of winning this war by yourselves.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: No one asked for your opinion.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_00.text:
How do you intend to disable
the plant without my aid?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_01.text:
If the pressure of the steam exceeds
a certain level, the plant will explode.
Accidents do happen, after all.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_02.text:
Certainly you will not require my help for
this 'accident.' Also, do you truly believe
that will be enough to disable it?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_03.text:
Everyone knows about the potential for
accidents. If this one causes excessive
damage, it will be on the Flame Tribe for
not taking proper precautions.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_403_CUT_000_04.text:
Interesting. Beyond simply destroying it,
you scheme to blame your enemy for the deed.
At last, you master the art of treachery!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text:
As the Wave Tribe cannot survive for long in
the open air, we have no intentions of stealing
the lands of others. All we desire is for all to
live in peace within their own territories.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text: Then why wage war with them at all?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text: Because they looked to conquer us! No, the peace we sought could only be secured through the destruction of all other temples.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We must increase our energy capacity without
attracting attention from the Forest Tribe.
To this end, we seek to upgrade our output
of wind energy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You will conceal your upgrades as
standard maintenance, perhaps?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, exactly so! Ah, but it is a relief
to have your keen insight on our side,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I know this trick well. Yet are you not
concerned the Forest Tribe will also
know of it?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed I am. In fact, the Forest Tribe are
certain to come investigate our dealings,
and I am at a loss for how to deter them.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Might I ask you to visit the wind farm?
I have no desire to risk trouble between
our peoples at this point.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I will use the majesty of my dark
lordship to suppress hostilities.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_00.text:
There are a great many of the Forest Tribe
here—they seem to be alert to your ruse.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_01.text:
It will be impossible to replace the
components necessary to boost our output
with so many people watching, Voyager.
What is to be done?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_03.text:
An interesting thought... Yet while the
Forest Tribe would certainly pay us little
mind during a fiend attack, it would also
place our workers in grave danger.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_000_04.text:
Except that your people will enjoy the
ample protections of the Dismal King!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_010_00.text:
I call for a minor fright and
you give me THAT!?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_301_CUT_010_01.text:
We may have gotten carried away a bit,
and for this, I apologize. But surely
they were no more than a minor
inconvenience for you, Voyager?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
As there has been no change to the Forest
Tribe's supply of energy, they currently
suspect nothing. We must use this chance
to strengthen our own position.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: By making weapons?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to take measures such as increasing
food production in order to become fully self-
sufficient. In this way, we can continue the
war even after the forest people cut off trade.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
A sound strategic objective.
I stand impressed.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
WindPriest
Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: You expect the Dismal King to review your farming practices? Shall I muck out a stable next?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_00.text: A barn—and a small one, at that.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_01.text:
With our wind power, even a small amount of
people can raise a large amount of livestock.
These will be used not only for consumption,
but for trade with other regions as well.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_02.text:
Strategically sound. So which part does
not work the way you expected?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_03.text:
Barns are of little use with no livestock to
fill them—but before we can gather our herds
from the pastures, we must deal with the
various fiends in the area.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_04.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_000_04.text:
Fiends yet again. Very well,
I shall handle it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_010_00.text:
I've cleared out the bulk of them.
Handle the stragglers yourselves.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_010_01.text:
Thank you, Voyager! Without your help,
we would be up for a severe tongue-lashing
from our leaders at the temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_010_02.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_302_CUT_010_02.text:
So you are reliant upon your temple?
Indeed, the darkness is beginning
to find its way in...

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Forest Tribe are completely oblivious,
and one small push may be all it takes to
win their surrender. As such, I intend to
attack their lumber mill.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
There is no stronger strategy
than taking a foe by surprise.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Such an attack is the best way to
minimize damage on both sides,
and therefore the optimal strategy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: I disagree. The whole point of surprise is to maximize damage.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No one is asking you to participate
in the attack, Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_303_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_303_CUT_000_00.text:
Was your alliance with the
Forest Tribe a lie all along?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_303_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_303_CUT_000_01.text:
We worked ourselves near to death in this forest,
yet the Forest Tribe never made any effort to
understand our ways. For us, this place holds
naught but painful memories.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Now we can finally raze this terrible forest!
We will turn it from a terrifying den of beasts
into a peaceful grassland savanna—for one cannot
live on lava and water, nor grow crops there.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
If you eradicate the trees,
the wind will stop.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
There will still be trees, Voyager—there is
simply no need for such dense forestland.
All that matters is the wind blowing through
the new grassy plains.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
How are we to defend ourselves from an assault by
the Gale Tribe? Alas, while we of the Forest Tribe
cannot match their strength, we've no choice but
to throw away our lives in the effort.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
While diplomacy is no hobby of mine,
surely it would be wise to discuss
the matter with them and strive to
reach some manner of understanding?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, we will definitely try that...
and afterward, we will optimize the
lumber mill! That is our only hope.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Neither of these is a task
worthy of the Dismal King.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would appreciate you going to the mill,
for I know your presence will bring
great cheer to all the workers.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would appreciate you going to the mill,
for I know your presence will bring
great cheer to all the workers.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_00.text:
There are a great many of the
Forest Tribe here. Why is this?

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_01.text:
We laid off laborers who will no longer be
needed due to the mill upgrades, and now
they're interfering with the process! We even offered to find them new jobs,
but they refuse to listen.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_02.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_02.text:
We may have to take stronger
measures to remove them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_03.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_03.text:
There is much darkness in your words,
and I suddenly find myself most eager
to see how this plays out.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_04.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_04.text:
Look out! Some of the fiends the
Flamewave League sent are still alive!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_05.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_000_05.text: The Dismal King will stay them!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_010_00.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_010_00.text:
With the former workers scattered,
we can now upgrade the mill.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_010_01.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_201_CUT_010_01.text:
Those were fiends of the woods. The darkness
of the Forest Tribe runs deep indeed to loose
such horrors upon their own people.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our talks with the Gale Tribe did nothing
but heighten suspicions. We should never
have engaged with them at all.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I should have known your
deepening darkness would
not allow for such resolution.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
In response, we've formed a cavalry composed
of workers who were made redundant by the mill
upgrade. That should allow us to match the
speed of the gale peoples' forces.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: For that, you will require stables.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Correct. As such, we would ask you to visit
the construction site, as we anticipate
interference from the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We would ask you to visit the construction
site of the stables, as we anticipate
interference from the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
It seems the darkness around the
Gale Tribe is deepening as well.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_202_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_202_CUT_000_00.text:
If the peace talks have ended in failure,
it is likely the Gale Tribe has some other
gambit planned. I cannot wait to see it!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_202_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_202_CUT_000_01.text:
The wind blows in a strange direction today... 
I wonder if the Gale Tribe is using it to send
some fell beast after us.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_202_CUT_010_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_202_CUT_010_00.text:
Are you certain the Gale Tribe set these fiends
upon you? Perhaps they simply came by as part
of their natural wanderings.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Gale Tribe derives its strength
from the energy of their wind farm.
Without it, they are powerless.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You've finally found the will to act.
But have you the capability?

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Gale Tribe uses its mastery of the breezes
to send countless fiends after us. We have no
option but to destroy the farm—although I do not
know if we actually possess the power to do so.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yet without the farm's electricity,
you will set back your own development
as a society.

SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_SIUG_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
That is of no concern. So long as we
have our forests, we can survive.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_203_CUT_000_00.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_203_CUT_000_00.text:
It was at this very spot that we battled the
fiends sent by the Flamewave Alliance.
I remember the event well.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_203_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_MISSION_203_CUT_000_01.text:
We will set the wind farm to burn.
If we are slain in the effort,
I leave the fate of the Forest Tribe
in your hands, Voyager. Farewell.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
The strength of the Gale Temple has been
reduced to nothing, and we can now live
lives free of worry. All praise to the forests, for they will
now spread unchecked across all of Cinq,
realizing our dream of a green world!

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
The darkness of the forest will blanket
this world entire. I see this as a most
wonderful thing, although the other tribes
may disagree with this assessment.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
The other peoples do not yet know the worth
of the forest. Once they see how wonderful
it is to make one's home among the canopy
of trees, they will come to see things our way.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
The new thralls I have acquired
justify my visit to this world.

SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Siugnas_Darkking
SUB_W07_EVAR_SIUG_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Your altar will not be rebuilt, imp.
How terrifically unfortunate for you.
And now, farewell.
